thread.title: Chicago Automobile Trade Association Announces 2015-2016 Executive Board

author: cbs8
title: Chicago Automobile Trade Association Announces 2015-2016 Executive Board
text:
Chicago Automobile Trade Association
Mike McGrath, Jr. Elected CATA Chairman and 2015 Chicago Auto Show Co-chairman alongside Colin Wickstrom
CHICAGO , Aug. 27, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- Mike McGrath, Jr., of McGrath Lexus , Acura, Honda and Hyundai, was recently elected to become the 2015-2016 Chicago Automobile Trade Association (CATA) chairman and the 2016 Chicago Auto Show co-chairman. McGrath will lead a board of 15 dealers and succeeds Colin Wickstrom , who is serving as chairman of the 2016 Chicago Auto Show.
Presiding over the largest volume Lexus and Acura dealers in the Midwest, McGrath brings more than 20 years of automotive retailing experience to the CATA board. In addition, McGrath is extremely active in local charitable organizations including the 100 Club of Chicago , American Cancer Society, Francis W. Parker School for Expanded Learning and the Children at the Crossroads Foundation.
"Franchised new-car dealers provide the best, most efficient and most cost-effective way to sell and distribute new cars," said McGrath. "The CATA, one of the oldest and largest metropolitan dealer associations in the nation, brings our dealerships together with a collective voice and provides resources to help dealers run more effectively. I am honored to lead the organization as its chairman."
Additional executive board officer announcements include: Vice Chairman John Hennessy , River View Ford ; Treasurer Ray Scarpelli Jr. , Raymond Chevrolet , Raymond Kia , Ray Chevrolet , ; and Secretary Tony Guido , Arlington Heights Ford. David Sloan remains the association president and Chicago Auto Show general manager.
To download a high-resolution photo of the CATA Executive Board, please click the following link: http://www.cata.info/assets/1/7/2015-16-CATA-Executive-Board.jpg .
About The Chicago Automobile Trade Association
Founded in 1904, the Chicago Automobile Trade Association is the nation's oldest and largest metropolitan dealer organization. It is comprised of more than 400 franchised new-car dealers and an additional 150 allied members. The group's dealer members employ about 19,000 people in the metropolitan area. The association has produced the world famous Chicago Auto Show since 1935. For more information please visit CATA.info .
